channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024030839
item.description:
Report X-2024030839

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal aerosol cans in corrugated inner and outer cartons with air pillow filler. Tucked-flap bottom closure came open. Loose can in outer carton punctured at base and released contents, soiling cartons and cans. No hazard markings or arrows on exterior. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024030784
item.description:
Report X-2024030784

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out for an Admin's assistance in containing the leakage. DescribePack: The bottle has a loose lid, which led to the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous material spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024030677
item.description:
Report X-2024030677

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: COLORADO SPRINGS
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/19/2024, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 2300567 at the station location in Colorado Springs, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing 3 1-quart plastic bottles labeled "Silver Nitrate". The shipment is discovered damaged from spillage from one of the bottles. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it does not have to required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and is being held pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. came to QA wet and leaking inside a line tote on the belt, pulled and placed inside hazmat cage to get inspected. DescribePack: Closure came loose which caused the liquid to leak out and soil outer carton and inner bottle. DurationRel: 45 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a lined and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic bottles in corrugated carton. Carton torn. Caps cracked and came off of three bottles. Contents of one bottle not as solid as described and spilled out, soiling bottles and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024030250
item.description:
Report X-2024030250

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal jerrican and metal bottle in zip-tied plastic bags inside corrugated carton with styrofoam peanut filler. Defective spout weld on jerrican allowed leakage which shriveled styrofoam peanut filler, soiled jerrican, and damaged carton. Carton still bears label from previous shipping under TRK # 789447976697, returned as improper hazmat for missing hazmat documents on 23 Jan 2024. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

DescribePack: Metal jerricans with taped caps in plastic zipper bags inside corrugated can-shipper carton with integrated dividers. Defective spout weld on one jerrican allowed spillage which soiled jerricans and damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024030259
item.description:
Report X-2024030259

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030259 SequenceEvent: QA was called to unload where there was a leaking hazmat and the outer carton was wet and the pkg. was placed inside a lined tote. DescribePack: Closure came loose on one inner bottle and the liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected. 2. X-2024030260 SequenceEvent: Pail was on load side when discovered leaking and QA was called and seen that it was a corrosive. DescribePack: Closure on top of pail was leaking about 2 cups leaked out of pail. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Pail was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic bottles in sealed plastic bags inside corrugated carton with eggcrate foam pad at top. Loose caps on bottles allowed leakage which soiled bottles and damaged carton. No hazard markings on exterior, though product is fully regulated. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024030258
item.description:
Report X-2024030258

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The pkg was being unloaded when in was noticeably wet. It was placed in a lined tote and taken to the designated damaged hazmat area. Upon opening it was discovered that the inner bottle had a loose cap which was allowing liquid to leak out. DescribePack: The inner bottle had a loose/defective cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed upright so the leaking wouldn't continue to leak.
